Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells stably expressing DMT1 either singly or in combination with wild type or mutant α-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: DMT1 overexpression dramatically enhances Fe2+ uptake, which concomitantly promotes cell death. This Fe2+-mediated toxicity is aggravated by the presence of mutant α-synuclein expression, resulting in increased oxidative stress and DNA damage.
DMT1 expression coupled with chronic iron treatment and α-synuclein led to increased cell death especially in cells expressing the A30P mutant.

Biological replicates.Description: All statistics were carried out using SPSS (Version 11) or GraphPad Prism (Version 4) software. One-way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons. This was followed by the Bonferroni's post hoc test.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells stably expressing DMT1 either singly or in combination with wild type or mutant α-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: After 4 days of iron treatment, it can be seen that there was substantial DNA damage in SD-A53T cells, whereas the SD-V controls displayed minimal damage.

Biological replicates.Description: 100 comets were randomly captured and analyzed for each slide. A minimum of triplicate sets for each treatment and cell line were carried out.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Hydrogen peroxide was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way analysis of variance was used to compare the values between two or more groups supported by multiple comparisons. This was followed by the Bonferroni's post hoc test.
